definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once

sentences.english: We are in great need of Grade A.
San Antonio Spurs When healthy, the Spurs are as good as anybody.
sentences.chinese: 只要保持健康，馬刺還是一等一強隊。

sentences.english: Also, since Japanese people are all about one-upmanship, they only eat baby shrimps.
sentences.chinese: 而日本人的飲食方法更是高人一等，它們只吃幼蝦。

sentences.english: It could be two or three times.
sentences.chinese: 恩，等一等，如果我想要排序一個列表。

sentences.english: Your room number is, just 8 moment, oh yes, it's 243.
sentences.chinese: 你的房間號碼是，等一等，哦對了，是243。

sentences.english: But the 32-inch model we'd like to buy was temporarily out of stock. We had to wait.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們想買的32吋機種暫時缺貨，所以得等一等。

sentences.english: This fellow is traveling in a first-class compartment on a second-class ticket.
sentences.chinese: 這個傢伙竟然拿着二等車廂的票坐一等車廂。

sentences.english: He went to talk with the woman, asking her to move out of the first-class section.
sentences.chinese: 副駕駛過去對她說，請她搬出一等艙。

sentences.english: The Education Department willrewardaward the first grants early next year.
sentences.chinese: 教育部明年早期會給一等獎發獎。

sentences.english: In school, my grades were excellent, won first-class university in scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 在校期間，我成績優異，獲得過校級一等獎學金。

sentences.english: A woman who did not marry was thought to be inferior and abnormal.
sentences.chinese: 一個不結婚的女人會被視爲不正常或低人一等。

sentences.english: The cold smile on his face made me guess that he considered himself to be superior to others.
sentences.chinese: 從他臉上的冷笑我猜想到他自以爲高人一等。

sentences.english: Just a second and I'll check the schedule.
sentences.chinese: 請等一等，我來查一下時刻表。

sentences.english: Finally, Zhu Pingkang won the first prize in the styling contest of motorboats with a score of 4297.
sentences.chinese: 最終，朱平康以4297分奪得摩托艇花樣賽一等獎。

sentences.english: But the developers also fell prey to one-upmanship.
sentences.chinese: 但是開發商也失去了高人一等的作風。

sentences.english: The first prize was awarded to the youngest competitor.
sentences.chinese: 一等獎授給了最年輕的比賽者。

definition: to wait to fill a vacancy/reserve (candidate)/alternate/substitute
you all (archaic)/see also 你們|你们[ni3 men5]
to promote to a higher position
superb/first-rate/(of officials in imperial times) the highest rank
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
to render meritorious service/to make worthy contributions/to distinguish oneself
ancient bronze wine holder with 3 legs and loop handle/nobility
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
